refnamediv.refpurpose: Provides access to the gconf module.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The gconf module provides a means for storing configuration parameters in a directory-like structure. This module supplies a couple of convenience wrappers for the most common ways an application will use gconf.

refsect2.title: gnome_gconf_get_gnome_libs_settings_relative ()
refsect2.para: Gets the full key name for a GNOME desktop specific setting for a specific application. Those keys are used to store application-specific configuration, for example the history of a GnomeEntry. This config space should only be used by libraries.

listitem.simpara: key part below the gnome desktop settings directory

refsect2.title: gnome_gconf_get_app_settings_relative ()
refsect2.para: Gets the full key name for an application specific setting. That is "/apps/<application_id>/subkey".

listitem.simpara: GnomeProgram pointer or NULL for the default
key part below the gnome desktop settings directory
